newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end up on higher expiry price.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end up on higher expiry price.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures closed higher on Monday, as the stronger expiry price of spot May encouraged local investors to buy, traders said.
Prices ranged from 2.9 to 4.5 yen per kg higher, with the benchmark October contract closing 2.9 yen up at 136.4 yen.
The day's estimated trade volume was 18,277 lots.
Spot May expired today at 128.5 yen, up by 0.5 yen from the Friday close, with deliveries totalling 499 lots.
"The stronger expiry price triggered active buying orders from local investors in the afternoon," a brokerage house trader said. -- Tokyo Commodities Desk (+81-3-3432-7391)
